questions.q: Is CredoCarbon a software platform or a consultancy?
questions.a: CredoCarbon provides professional execution supported by structured digital workflows. We price execution time, not software access.

questions.q: How do payments and milestones work?
questions.a: Fees are milestone-based and aligned with delivery stages. Third-party fees are passed through transparently.

questions.q: Do you guarantee issuance or regulatory approval?
questions.a: No. Issuance and approval decisions are made by registries and regulators.

questions.q: Is feasibility and revenue analysis really free?
questions.a: Yes. Feasibility, registry fit assessment, and indicative revenue modelling are provided at no cost.

questions.q: Are registry and verifier (VVB) fees included?
questions.a: No. Registry and validation or verification body fees are charged at cost and billed separately.

questions.q: Why does pricing vary by registry or methodology?
questions.a: Different registries and methodologies have different documentation, review cycles, and audit requirements.

questions.question: What does CredoCarbon do?
questions.answer: CredoCarbon manages the execution of carbon credit, renewable energy certificate (REC), and emissions compliance workflows‚Äîcovering registration, monitoring, issuance, and coordination across global registries and schemes.

questions.question: Who is CredoCarbon built for?
questions.answer: CredoCarbon is built for carbon project developers, renewable energy generators, corporate buyers, energy market participants, and regulated entities participating in voluntary and compliance carbon markets.

questions.question: Is CredoCarbon a software platform or a consultancy?
questions.answer: CredoCarbon is an execution platform. We combine professional carbon market expertise with structured digital workflows to replace fragmented, manual consulting‚Äîwithout offering self-serve SaaS or acting as a broker.

questions.question: Which carbon and energy markets does CredoCarbon support?
questions.answer: CredoCarbon supports voluntary carbon markets, renewable energy certificate (REC) systems, and emissions trading and compliance schemes across multiple regions.

questions.question: Which registries and schemes are supported?
questions.answer: CredoCarbon works across leading global carbon registries, REC systems, and compliance registries. Registry and scheme coverage depends on project type, geography, and regulatory applicability.

questions.question: Does CredoCarbon operate internationally?
questions.answer: Yes. CredoCarbon supports cross-border carbon and energy market workflows, coordinating with international registries, verification bodies, and regulators.

questions.question: How does an engagement with CredoCarbon typically start?
questions.answer: Engagements typically begin with a feasibility and eligibility assessment. Once scope is confirmed, CredoCarbon executes the required registration, issuance, or compliance workflows.

questions.question: Can CredoCarbon work alongside existing consultants or partners?
questions.answer: Yes. CredoCarbon can integrate with existing consultants, EPCs, technical advisors, or internal teams, with responsibilities clearly defined to avoid duplication or scope overlap.

questions.question: How long do carbon projects or transactions usually take?
questions.answer: Timelines vary by registry, methodology, and project type. CredoCarbon focuses on reducing coordination delays, but final timelines depend on external registry and verification review cycles.

questions.question: How is data and confidential information handled?
questions.answer: CredoCarbon operates under strict confidentiality standards and executes non-disclosure agreements (NDAs) where required.

questions.question: Does CredoCarbon guarantee issuance or regulatory approval?
questions.answer: No. Issuance and approvals are determined by registries and regulators. CredoCarbon supports compliant documentation and execution through each required stage.

questions.question: How is CredoCarbon different from traditional carbon consultants?
questions.answer: CredoCarbon replaces fragmented, manual consulting with structured execution, standardized workflows, and reduced coordination overhead‚Äîwhile remaining independent from trading and brokerage activities.

role.title: Your Role
role.description: As a VVB (Validation & Verification Body), you are responsible for independently assessing carbon projects to ensure they meet the required standards and accurately report emission reductions.

types.title: Validation
types.description: Review project design documents, methodology application, and baseline calculations before project implementation.

types.title: Verification
types.description: Verify actual emission reductions achieved during monitoring periods against claimed reductions.

features.title: Pending Tasks
features.description: View all assigned validations and verifications awaiting your review.

features.title: My Projects
features.description: Browse all projects assigned to you, organized by task type and status.

features.title: Queries
features.description: Manage clarification requests sent to developers and review their responses.

features.title: Notifications
features.description: Receive alerts for new assignments, query responses, and deadline reminders.

steps.title: Receive Assignment
steps.description: Projects are assigned by the platform administrator. You'll receive a notification with project details.

steps.title: Review Documents
steps.description: Access and review all project documentation including PDD, methodology, baseline, and monitoring plan.

steps.title: Complete Checklist
steps.description: Work through the validation checklist, marking items as compliant or raising queries as needed.

steps.title: Submit Decision
steps.description: Approve the project for the next phase or reject with detailed justification.

steps.title: Review Monitoring Data
steps.description: Examine data collected during the monitoring period, including generation records and emission calculations.

steps.title: Verify Calculations
steps.description: Cross-check claimed emission reductions against monitoring data. Apply any necessary adjustments.

steps.title: Account for Deductions
steps.description: Calculate leakage deductions and buffer pool contributions as per methodology requirements.

steps.title: Issue Verification Report
steps.description: Document verified emission reductions and submit for registry review.

role.title: Your Role
role.description: As a Registry Officer, you are responsible for the final review and approval of carbon projects, issuance of carbon credits, and maintaining the integrity of the carbon credit registry.

types.title: Project Review
types.description: Review validated and verified projects to ensure compliance with registry standards before credit issuance.

types.title: Credit Issuance
types.description: Issue carbon credits to projects that pass review, assign serial numbers, and record in the registry.

features.title: Queries

steps.title: Review All Documentation

steps.title: Complete Review Checklist
